course.course_name: Introduction To Computer Applications In Health Care and Biomedicine
course.course_description: Overview of the field of biomedical informatics,combining perspectives from medicine, computer science, and social science. Use of computers and information in health care and the biomedical sciences, covering specific applications and general methods, current issues, capabilities and limitations of biomedical informatics.

Prerequisites: Medical Informatics G4001, Computer Science W3139.  Survey of the methods underlying the field of medical informatics.  Explores techniques in mathematics, logic, decision science, computer science, engineering, cognitive science, management science and epidemiology, and demonstrates the application to health care and biomedicine.

course.course_name: Acculturation In Medicine for Information Specialists
course.course_description: Overview of the field of medicine for informaticians.  Medical language and terminology, introduction to pathology and pathophysiology, the process of medical decision making, and an understanding of how information flows in the practice of medicine.
Survey of the major problems in the present-day eclectic field called genomics or bioinformatics; exploration of computational methods for gene discovery.

course.course_name: Representation and Coding of Medical Data
course.course_description: Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001. Methods for representing information in medical systems including clinical data about patients, indexing information for medical knowledge resources, and expert systems.  Analysis of existing national and international standards.  Exploration of knowledge-based approaches to medical terminology representation, maintenance and use.

Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4020. Overview of the special challenges in developing interfaces between humans and computers for medical applications. Data presentation, data entry, and usability testing, as they apply to the medical domain.
Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4020. Theoretical foundations of perception in visual information, from the perspectives of human cognition, computer technology, and social science.
Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001, Computer Science W3139.  Survey of the various imaging modalities used in medicine, and the computational methods used in processing them..
Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001. Design of computer systems for health care, distributed system architectures, management of heterogeneity, layers of communication, data exchange standards.

course.course_name: Quantitative Models for Medical Decision Making
course.course_description: Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001. Survey of a number of techniques for quantitative reasoning, including probabilistic reasoning, decision analysis, ROC analysis, and meta-analysis.

Prerequisites: Medical Informatics G4001 and Biostatistics P6104. Overview of the various techniques used in providing computerized clinical decision support, both from the perspective of the underlying theory and the applications designed using the theory.

Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001.  Methods of structuring knowledge in medicine from multiple perspectives; knowledge structures in traditional information environments such as libraries; cognitive theories of learning and methods of instruction; principles of visual displays for presenting knowledge;  computational issues for representing and manipulating knowledge.

Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001, Biostatistics P6104.  Methods for evaluating the use of information systems in health care.  Quantitative methods, including measurement and demonstration studies; qualitative methods; sources bias.

course.course_name: Economics of Informatics: Cost and Investment Issues In Healthcare Information Technology
course.course_description: Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G4001.  Cost models in information technology in health care settings, including total cost of ownership, value chain analysis and return on investment.
Presentations by students on current literature and their research; addressing a broad range of topics in the field.

Prerequisite: open to public. Presentations by medical informatics faculty and invited international speakers in medical informatics, computer science, nursing informatics, library science, and related fields.
Research in medical informatics under the direction of a faculty adviser.
course.course_instructors_actual: A. Califano, A. Kanter, A. Wilcox, C. Friedman, C. Weng, D. Pe'er, D. Vawdrey, D. Vitkup, G. Hripcsak, H. Chase, I. Pe'er, J. Merrill-Matzner, N. Elhadad, N. Tatonetti, O. Mamykina, P. Stetson, R. Kukafka, R. Rabadan, S. Bakken, Y. Shen
course.course_instructors_full: A. Califano, A. Kanter, A. Wilcox, C. Friedman, C. Weng, D. Pe'er, D. Vawdrey, D. Vitkup, G. Hripcsak, H. Chase, I. Pe'er, J. Merrill-Matzner, N. Elhadad, N. Tatonetti, O. Mamykina, P. Stetson, R. Kukafka, R. Rabadan, S. Bakken, Y. Shen

course.course_name: M.a. Essay In Medical Informatics, I
course.course_description: Prerequisite: enrollment in M.A. degree program. Development of a proposal for a research project to be carried out with the supervision of a faculty adviser.

course.course_name: M.a. Essay In Medical Informatics, II
course.course_description: Prerequisite: Medical Informatics G6090 and G6001. Writing of an original manuscript summarizing the achievements of an applied research project in medical informatics.
Prerequisite: approval of adviser. Readings on topics in medical informatics under the direction of a faculty adviser.
Prerequisite: instructor’s permission. Participation in medical informatics educational activities under the direction of a faculty adviser.
course.course_instructors_actual: A. Wilcox, B. Forman, C. Weng, D. Vawdrey, D. Vitkup, G. Kuperman, H. Chase, J. Cimino, N. Elhadad, P. Stetson, R. Friedman, R. Kukafka, R. Rabadan
course.course_instructors_full: A. Wilcox, B. Forman, C. Weng, D. Vawdrey, D. Vitkup, G. Kuperman, H. Chase, J. Cimino, N. Elhadad, P. Stetson, R. Friedman, R. Kukafka, R. Rabadan

course.course_description: Prerequisite: completion of all M.Phil. requirements, and approval of a research proposal by the supervising faculty adviser.
course.course_instructors_actual: A. Califano, A. Kanter, C. Friedman, C. Weng, D. Pe'er, D. Vitkup, I. Pe'er, N. Elhadad, R. Rabadan
course.course_instructors_full: A. Califano, A. Kanter, C. Friedman, C. Weng, D. Pe'er, D. Vitkup, I. Pe'er, N. Elhadad, R. Rabadan

course.course_description: Prerequisite: completion of all M.Phil. requirements. Ph.D. candidates may be required to register for this course every term during the preparation of the dissertation.
